intro: Eusteralis, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are bright yellow, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Eusteralis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
